meanings.definition: A state of uneasiness or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The sudden noise outside filled her with disquietude.
meanings.sent2: The disquietude in the room was palpable as they awaited the test results.
meanings.sent3: His disquietude over the upcoming presentation made him practice excessively.
meanings.sent4: The disquietude in her heart was like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The disquietude of the dark forest at night was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel anxious or uneasy.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected news disquietuded him greatly.
meanings.sent2: Her constant criticism only served to disquietude her employees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten disquietuded the peaceful atmosphere of the house.
meanings.sent4: The uncertainty of the future disquietuded her like a persistent shadow.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house disquietuded the brave explorers.
